item.title: Report E-2024080689
item.description:
Report E-2024080689

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T00:56:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: Granite City
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIR PRODUCTS AND CHEMICALS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At approximately 2230pm on Monday July 29, 2024 a driver had begun to load a Liquid Nitrogen Trailer. As the driver struck the knuckle, the tail piece broke clean off and sprayed the driver's leg with Liquid Nitrogen. The driver had all proper PPE on and evacuated the area. The pull away eventually shut down the loading process and the assistant operator closed the top and bottom fill valves.

item.title: Report X-2024100904
item.description:
Report X-2024100904

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-03
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN EAST PRIMARY AND NOTICED A LEAKING HAZMAT. USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAINERIZE AND CLEAN UP THE SPILLED MATERIAL. PACKAGE AND MATERIAL WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES OF PACKEAGE, PACKAGE MATERIAL WAS SOLIDIFIED AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP. THE PROCESSED MATERIAL WAS PLACED IN THE UNCONFIRMED DMP AREA UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.

item.title: Report X-2024100903
item.description:
Report X-2024100903

  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DRIVER NOTICED POWDER COMING OUT FROM HAZMAT PACKAGE AFTER PUTTING IT DOWN IN THE PACKAGE CAR. DRIVER NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR AND SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RMP. RMP SENDED DOWN A RESPONDER TO OAKBROOK CENTER. RESPONDER ARRVIES WITH PPE ON, SPILL CART, AND DECISION TREE. RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY COTAINS HAZMAT PACKAGE AND REMAINING POWDER ON THE FLOOR FROM HAZMAT PACKAGE.

item.description:
Report E-2024100341

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0016 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XDP. It was reported that approximately 1/2 gallon of Gold Assassin RTU Concentrated Cleaner Degreaser was released from a 5-gallon plastic jug due to a forklift puncture by XML. The release impacted trailer #3213813. (1) 5-gallon metal drum contains: Gold Assassin RTU Concentrated Cleaner Degreaser.

item.title: Report X-2024100607
item.description:
Report X-2024100607

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the ORDR location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans and the lid of one can came off spilling the contents. While investigating the contents the spill agent determined they were a UN1171. The outer fiberboard box did not have any DG markings or paperwork. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and are being held for the FAA.

  • Description: SUPERVISOR NOTIFIES RMP ABOUT LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE. RMP SENDS RESPONDER DOWN TO BAY 307 WITH PPE ON, STOCKED SPILL CART, AND DECISION TREE. RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINS LEAKING PACKAGE AND OTHER CONTAMINATED PACKAGES FROM INSIDE TRAILER.

item.title: Report E-2024100306
item.description:
Report E-2024100306

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 00:50 EST on 9/19, XPO-XLA contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 cups of "Alum Brite Etching Cleaner" from a 55-gallon poly drum. The drum fell through the faulty pallet and was punctured by a nail. The contractors neutralized the trailer and overpacked the 55-gallon poly drum into (1) 95-gallon metal drum, impacted pads, pallet and cardboard were containerized into (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.
